Soal Mantan Napi Korupsi dan Legislator Maju Pilkada, KPU Bengkulu Masih Tunggu PKPU
06 Nov 2019, 18:53 by Roki EP


Soal Mantan Napi Korupsi dan Legislator Maju Pilkada, KPU Bengkulu Masih Tunggu PKPU

KBRN, Bengkulu : Kendati pihak Komisi Pemilihan Umum (KPU) RI sudah berulang kali mengemukakan larangan bagi mantan napi korupsi untuk maju dalam Pilkada, namun regulasi yang mengaturnya hingga kini belum final.
Dengan belum adanya aturan secara resmi tersebut, pihak KPU Provinsi Bengkulu masih menunggu keputusan dari KPU RI.
Mengingat untuk Peraturan KPU (PKPU)-nya saat ini masih dalam tahap pembahasan.
“Kita sebagai penyelenggara Pilkada di daerahmengacu pada PKPU, tapi sampai sekarang masih ditunggu keputusannya,” ungkap Ketua KPU Provinsi Bengkulu Irwan Saputra, ketika dihubungi sejumlah wartawan.
Irwan menjelaskan, dalam pembahasan PKPU larangan bagi mantan tindak pidana korupsi (tipikor) termasuk, wacana anggota dewan wajib mundurapabila maju sebagai seorang balon kepala daerah ataupun wakil kepala daerah dalam Pilkada tahun depan, sejuah ini pihaknya juga belum bisa memastikannya.Apalagi untuk tahapan pendaftaran balon kepala daerah dan wakil kepala daerah ke KPU juga baru akan berlangsung tahun depan.
“Kita tunggu saja aturannya bagaimana dan setelah keluar itu yang menjadi pedoman nantinya,” katanya, Rabu, (6/11/2019).
Sementara itu, Anggota DPR RI dari Fraksi PDI Perjuangan Elva Hartati ketika dihubungi wartawan mengaku, soal mantan napi apakah boleh maju atau tidak maju dalam Pilkada, sudah diatur dalam undang-undang.
Sedangkan untuk anggota Dewan baik DPR dan DPD RI atau DPRD wajib mundur ketika menjadi calon kepala daerah, saat ini revisi Undang Undangnya masih dibahas.
“Sekarang revisi Undang-Undang Nomor 10 tahun 2016 tentang persyaratan Cakada, baru dibahas oleh pihak Komisi II.Kita tunggu saja nanti bagaimana keputusan akhirnya,” terang Elva.
Ditanya apakah akan mencalonkan, jika keputusan nanti memperbolehkan dewan mencalonkan dan tidak mundur melainkan hanya cuti, lagi-lagi Ketua DPD PDIP Provinsi Bengkulu ini menyebutkan, tetap menunggu instruksi dari pusat.
Hanya saja khusus di PDIP saat ini sudah melaksanakan penjaringan Cakada dan nama-nama Cakada telah diserahkan ke DPPPDIP di Jakarta.
“Jika nanti ternyata revisi UU itu disahkan dan dewan tidak wajib mundur. Lalu apakah akan membuka pendaftaran ulang atau tidaknya, juga kita melihat sejauh mana kebutuhannya, dan itu tergantung instruksi dari DPP,” tukas Elva.

The Problem of Former Corruption Inmates and Legislators Advanced Election, Bengkulu KPU Still Waiting for PKPU
Nov 6, 2019, 18:53 by Roki EP


The Problem of Former Corruption Inmates and Legislators Advanced Election, Bengkulu KPU Still Waiting for PKPU

KBRN, Bengkulu: Even though the Indonesian General Election Commission (KPU) has repeatedly stated the prohibition for former corruption inmates to advance in the elections, but the regulations governing it have not been final.
In the absence of official regulations, the Bengkulu Provincial KPU is still waiting for a decision from the Indonesian KPU.
Considering that the KPU Regulation (PKPU) is currently still under discussion.
"We as regional election organizers refer to PKPU, but until now the decision is still awaited," said Bengkulu Province KPU Chairman Irwan Saputra, when contacted by a number of journalists.
Irwan explained, in the discussion of PKPU the prohibition of former corruption (tipikor) included, the discourse of the members of the council was obliged to resign if it went forward as a balloon of the regional head or deputy head of the region in the local elections next year, this party also could not confirm it. Especially for the balloon registration stage regional heads and deputy regional heads to the KPU will also take place next year.
"Let's just wait for the rules how and after the exit is the guideline later," he said, Wednesday (11/06/2019).
Meanwhile, Elva Hartati, a DPR member from the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle (PDI-P) Faction, when contacted by reporters, said that whether ex-prisoners were allowed to go forward or not go ahead in the elections, it was regulated by law.
Whereas for DPR members, both DPR and DPD RI or DPRD must resign when they become candidates for regional head, currently the revision of the Bill of Law is still being discussed.
"Now the revision of Law Number 10 of 2016 concerning the Cakada requirements is only discussed by the Commission II. We will wait for the final decision," Elva explained.
Asked whether to nominate, if the decision later allows the council to nominate and not resign but only leave, again the Chairman of the DPD PDIP Bengkulu Province said, still waiting for instructions from the center.
It's just that the PDI-P has now carried out the Cakada screening and the names of the Cakada have been submitted to the DPPPDIP in Jakarta.
"If later it turns out the revision of the Act was passed and the council is not obliged to resign. Then whether we will re-register or not, we also see the extent of their needs, and that depends on the instructions from the DPP, "said Elva.
